title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Do not accept fall of or end of Communism in the world or globally.

1 point is earned for a correct identification.
descriptions: The response does not correctly identify one of the following geopolitical events that initiated change in the number of international boundaries in Europe between 1980 and 2013:
The response correctly identifies one of the following geopolitical events that initiated change in the number of international boundaries in Europe between 1980 and 2013:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Two points are earned for both a correct explanation and a correct example description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain how nationalism can eliminate an international boundary or describe an example from the maps shown, including the following:
The response correctly explains or describes one of the following:
The response correctly explains and describes both of the following:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Two points are earned for both a correct explanation and a correct example description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain how nationalism can create new international boundaries, nor does it describe an example from the maps shown, failing to include the following:
The response correctly explains how nationalism can create new international boundaries, or it describes an example from the maps shown, failing to include both of the following:
The response correctly explains how nationalism can create new international boundaries, and it describes an example from the maps shown, including both of the following:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Two points are earned for two correct descriptions.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe two ways supranationalism has affected the functions of international boundaries in Europe, including any of the following ways:
The response correctly describes one way that supranationalism has affected the functions of international boundaries in Europe, including any one of the following ways:
The response correctly describes two ways that supranationalism has affected the functions of international boundaries in Europe, including two of the following ways:
